page.title: 01Lower Hayton,Upper Hayton
page.content: This district of valley and hills must surely be some of the most beutiful countryside in Shropshire. It is a rural farming area, sheep cattle, both for milk and beef, a turkey farm and beekeepers. The valley has rich, fertile soil with the river Corve running alongside. It provides grazing ground, and arable land where crops of cereal and oil seed rape are sown in autumn Two narrow steep roads led from valley to bent, each has a chapel one derelict, one transcendental meditation, many old cottages, farm houes, and an old school now the village hall. Woodlands abound conifer and hardwood not well cared for. Some small shafts from an attempted copper mining in 19th century. An abundance of wild life animals, birds, flowers.
